oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Political cartoon, "The Tailor and Rail-Splitter Mending the Union"
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Political cartoon depicting Andrew Johnson seated on a world globe, stitching together a map of the United States, with Abraham Lincoln using a "rail-splitter" to reposition it.

This political cartoon echoes an 1865 illustration by Joseph E. Baker, in which Johnson is saying, "Take it quietly, Uncle Abe, and I will draw it closwer [sic] than ever." Lincoln replies, "A few more stitches, Andy, and the good old Union will be mended."
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Johnson, Andrew, 1808-1875; Lincoln, Abraham, 1809-1865; Baker, Joseph E., ca. 1837-1914; Reconstruction (U.S. history, 1865-1877); Political cartoons; Caricatures and cartoons
Presidents; Vice presidents; Political cartoons; caricatures
